dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla b Rampaul 102 (109b 8x4 0x6 130m) SR: 93.57

dismissalComment.html: gone! Stumps splattered! That has come out of nowhere! Rampaul lands his first ball on a decent line and length, Amla plays back to one he should have come forward to, and it clatters into the stumps. West Indies really needed that

dismissalComment.html: that's the line! Bravo pulls his length back a touch and keeps the ball in the channel outside off stump. Smith's feet went nowhere as he tried to force through the covers, and Ramdin is the grateful recipient of the resulting thick edge. One down!

headshotImage.caption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: double strike from Bravo! The ball wasn't great - a short, wide long hop. But Kallis really reached for it as he tried to slash over the off side. A big top edge flew down to third man, where the fielder held on to an easy chance. Another one goes down!

dismissalText.commentary: Chris Gayle c Botha b Morkel 45 (39b 8x4 0x6 51m) SR: 115.38

dismissalComment.html: one shot too many from Gayle, and he's easily caught off another spiralling top edge. The pressure was mounting on him with Sarwan unable to rotate the strike effectively and he went for another massive swipe to leg. He sent the ball up really high, but Botha was right underneath it at midwicket to hold onto the chance. Big, big wicket there

dismissalText.commentary: Andre Fletcher c Kallis b Steyn 3 (12b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: edged, and gone! Test match bowling from Steyn, and it's too good for Fletcher. The ball was fast, pitched up on off stump and swinging away. Fletcher came forward but couldn't cover the movement and the ball absolutely flew off the outside edge to Kallis at second slip. He took a good, sharp catch right infront of his face, and that's another failure with the bat for Fletcher

dismissalText.commentary: Ravi Rampaul c Smith b Tsotsobe 3 (8b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 37.5

dismissalComment.html: that's it! All over! Comprehensive victory for South Africa. Rampaul tries to smack it down the ground, doesn't get much of it and Smith takes the catch. Gentle high-fives all round for the South African's. Gayle does not look overly amused, but shakes hands with all the opposition players.

dismissalText.commentary: Ravi Rampaul c Smith b Tsotsobe 3 (8b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 37.5

commentTextItems.html: that's it! All over! Comprehensive victory for South Africa. Rampaul tries to smack it down the ground, doesn't get much of it and Smith takes the catch. Gentle high-fives all round for the South African's. Gayle does not look overly amused, but shakes hands with all the opposition players.

commentPostTextItems.html: There were glimpses when the West Indies were in that chase, Gayle was fortunate but got off to a good start, and later Pollard muscled some hope, but really, West Indies were not good enough again. The talent is there, the execution is not.
Gayle predictably is very disappointed but defends the team selection, arguing that it's up to the top five to set the game up, not get more batsmen to shorten the tail.
Smith is more chirpy and says that South Africa will experiment with their side as the look to find the formula that suits them.
Hashim Amla is named man of the match, as well he should be after his superb century.
Liam is finetuning his bulletin so do check that out. I hope you've enjoyed today, the next game is on Monday so please do join us then.

commentTextItems.html: nicely turned off his legs into the midwicket region for a single

Miller attempts to smash it to cow corner, but cannot time it at all and it trickles down the ground

banged in short, very short, Rampaul has to jump and throw his arms at it, but can't connect
good strike from Miller, down on one knee and smacking it over midwicket for a boundary, one final cheer for the lively crowd

commentTextItems.html: that's it! All over! Comprehensive victory for South Africa. Rampaul tries to smack it down the ground, doesn't get much of it and Smith takes the catch. dismissalText.commentary: Andre Fletcher c Kallis b Steyn 3 (12b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: edged, and gone! Test match bowling from Steyn, and it's too good for Fletcher. The ball was fast, pitched up on off stump and swinging away. Fletcher came forward but couldn't cover the movement and the ball absolutely flew off the outside edge to Kallis at second slip. He took a good, sharp catch right infront of his face, and that's another failure with the bat for Fletcher

dismissalText.commentary: Chris Gayle c Botha b Morkel 45 (39b 8x4 0x6 51m) SR: 115.38

dismissalComment.html: one shot too many from Gayle, and he's easily caught off another spiralling top edge. The pressure was mounting on him with Sarwan unable to rotate the strike effectively and he went for another massive swipe to leg. He sent the ball up really high, but Botha was right underneath it at midwicket to hold onto the chance. Big, big wicket there

He was neither forward nor back, just flung the bat at it, and de Villiers snaffled the regulation chance behind the stumps

milestones.description: Kallis has broken the record for most catches (111) in ODIs for SA, going past Gibbs's 108

stories.title: South Africa continue success with 66-run win
stories.subTitle: West Indies v South Africa, 1st ODI, Antigua
stories.seoTitle: South Africa continue success with 66-run win
stories.summary: South Africa carried their Twenty20 success into the one-day series with a 66-run win over West Indies in the first game at the Sir Vivian Richards stadium in Antigua

image.caption: Dwayne Bravo and Kieron Pollard celebrate the dismissal of Graeme Smith
image.longCaption: Dwayne Bravo and Kieron Pollard celebrate the dismissal of Graeme Smith, West Indies v South Africa, 1st ODI, Antigua, May 22, 2010

stories.title: Hosts aim to fix batting woes
stories.subTitle: West Indies v South Africa, 1st ODI, Antigua
stories.seoTitle: Hosts aim to fix batting woes
stories.summary: The 50-over format must come as a relief for West Indies, allowing Ramnaresh Sarwan and Shivnarine Chanderpaul greater time to build their innings, while giving a misfiring top order an opportunity to rediscover lost touch

image.caption: JP Duminy prepares to play the ball
image.longCaption: JP Duminy prepares to play the ball, Antigua, May 21 2010

stories.title: Smith looks to maintain winning momentum
stories.subTitle: West Indies v South Africa, 1st ODI, Antigua
stories.seoTitle: Smith looks to maintain winning momentum
stories.summary: Graeme Smith looks to continue South Africa's winning run going into the ODI series against West Indies, as his side seeks to recover confidence after a forgettable World Twenty20 campaign
